intro: Mammillaria candida, commonly known as the white globose cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and white, woolly spines that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xerophytic gardens. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
